channel.title: Comments on: David Hartman Part III
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: IH
item.dc:creator: IH
item.description:
As part of the homework, we should (re)read Lawrence Kaplan’s article in the February 2010 Modern Judaism: “From Cooperation to Conflict: Rabbi Professor Emanuel Rackman, Rav Joseph B. Soloveitchik, and the Evolution of American Modern Orthodoxy”.
Soloveitchik/Rackman 1950 vs. 1975 is instructive to looking at Hartman 1985 vs. 2011; particularly in light of Chapter 5 in the new book (which footnotes Kaplan’s article).
item.content:encoded:
As part of the homework, we should (re)read Lawrence Kaplan’s article in the February 2010 Modern Judaism: “From Cooperation to Conflict: Rabbi Professor Emanuel Rackman, Rav Joseph B. Soloveitchik, and the Evolution of American Modern Orthodoxy”.

Soloveitchik/Rackman 1950 vs. 1975 is instructive to looking at Hartman 1985 vs. 2011; particularly in light of Chapter 5 in the new book (which footnotes Kaplan’s article).
